trans-unit.source: Represents the responses to a <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryContinuation"></xref> object containing the URI that is used to retrieve the next results page.
An object containing the URI that is used to return the next results page.
Gets a <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryContinuation"></xref> object containing the URI that is used to retrieve the next page of related entities in the specified collection.
The <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse.GetContinuation%2A> method is used to obtain the URI that is used to retrieve the next results page for a nested result.
Specify a `null` value for `collection` when the collection is the top-level collection.
The collection of related objects being loaded.
A continuation object that points to the next page for the collection.

Gets a <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQueryContinuation`1"></xref> object that contains the URI that is used to retrieve the next page of related entities in the specified collection.
The collection of related objects being loaded.
The type of the items in the collection.
A continuation object that points to the next page for the collection.
Executes the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery"></xref> and returns <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse"></xref> items.
The enumerator to a collection of <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse"></xref> items.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery"></xref> that generates the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.QueryOperationResponse"></xref> items.
A <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery"></xref> object.
The server result set count value from a query, if the query has requested the value.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is raised when count was not part of the original request, that is, if the count tag is not found in the response stream.
The return value can be either a zero or positive value equal to the number of entities in the set on the server.
Thrown when the count tag is not found in the response stream.
